benchmark_details.name: UI-L EVEL EVALUATION OF ALL AM 34B
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents an expanded and refined UI-level evaluation of the ALLaM −34B, detailing a structured evaluation pipeline for assessing its performance across various tasks relevant to Arabic language models, including understanding dialects, code-switching, and safety-related scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive UI-level evaluation of the ALLaM −34B Arabic language model, ensuring that it meets the linguistic and cultural needs of Arabic speakers.

data.source: Responses were collected using HUMAIN Chat by submitting prompts designed to evaluate various aspects of the ALLaM −34B model.
data.annotation: Responses were scored by multiple judges based on predefined metrics.

methods: Multi-metric scoring by independent LLM judges
methodology.calculation: Mean scores were computed for individual responses and categories based on judged evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: High scores in fluency and safety indicate the model's strong performance across various tasks relevant to the Arabic language.
methodology.validation: A human evaluation was conducted alongside LLM judging to assess dialectal fidelity and cultural appropriateness.
